0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Conduct risk assessments on shipments to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
Verify shipment documents, including commercial invoices and certificates of origin, for accuracy and completeness.
Prepare and submit required export declarations and forms to the relevant authorities.
Facilitate communication between clients, carriers, and government agencies regarding shipments and customs procedures.
Clear cargo at U.S. ports, including clearing goods through U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) systems.
Negotiate with carriers, exporters, and importers to resolve discrepancies or disputes related to shipments.
Provide guidance on compliance requirements for international trade regulations, including Harmonized System (HS) codes and duties.
Monitor and respond to changes in customs regulations, tariffs, or other relevant laws impacting clients' operations.
Conduct audits of client shipments to ensure accuracy of declared values, descriptions, and country of origin information.
Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including carriers, freight forwarders, and government agencies.
Create and manage client records, including shipment history, cargo details, and customs documentation.
Process and clear shipments through U.S. CBP systems, including Automated Export System (AES) and Commercial Importer Manifest System (CIMS).
Prepare and submit required paperwork, such as commercial invoices, bills of lading, and certificates of origin, on behalf of clients.
Coordinate with carriers to ensure proper delivery of shipments, including arranging for pick-ups and drop-offs.
Research and obtain necessary licenses, permits, and certifications for international trade operations.
Prepare and submit reports to clients and regulatory agencies regarding shipment status, customs compliance, and other relevant information.
Resolve issues related to cargo detention, fines, or penalties resulting from non-compliance with customs regulations.
Stay up-to-date on changes in customs regulations, laws, and industry standards impacting clients' operations.
Develop and implement customs brokerages procedures and protocols for improving efficiency and reducing errors.
Develop and manage client budgets and forecasts to optimize freight costs and improve operational efficiency.
Provide training and education to clients, carriers, and other stakeholders on customs regulations, compliance requirements, and industry standards.

Develop a learning management system (LMS) integration strategy for our existing employee database, enhancing data analytics capabilities and reporting.
Design and conduct workshops on leadership development, effective communication skills, and time management strategies for top-performing employees to improve productivity.
Assess training needs of employees across various departments and design customized training programs to address skill gaps and upskill personnel.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop training content for new product launches, focusing on sales, marketing, and technical teams.
Manage the budget and resource allocation for the training department, ensuring effective utilization of available funds and personnel.
Conduct regular evaluation and assessment of training programs to ensure alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
Foster partnerships with external organizations to access industry expertise and best practices in training and development.
Coordinate logistics for corporate training events, conferences, and workshops, including venue selection, catering, and audiovisual equipment.
Create a learning framework that aligns with the company's overall performance management strategy, emphasizing continuous professional development.
Design and implement online modules or courses to support remote workers, ensuring seamless access to training resources across the organization.

Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety standards.
Source and procure fresh ingredients from suppliers in compliance with budgetary limits.
Assist in inventory management by monitoring food stock levels and ordering supplies as needed.
Monitor and control cooking temperatures, timers, and other equipment to ensure optimal food quality.
Present dishes in an attractive and appealing manner to enhance customer satisfaction.
Maintain accurate records of menu items, food costs, and kitchen operations for reporting purposes.
Clean and sanitize cooking surfaces, utensils, and equipment according to institutional protocols.
Ensure all food handlers are trained and compliant with health and safety regulations.
Coordinate meal preparation and service during peak periods or special events.
